Each has unique visual style, ambient sounds, challenges, and dog behavior. Location learning - app remembers usual parking spots. Dogs comment on familiar neighborhoods. Time-of-day variations (day/night/late night). Weather integration affects gameplay.

title: Dog backstory generator & enhanced personalities
description: Each dog gets unique backstory: origin neighborhood, former occupation (street dog/show dog/junkyard dog), defining moment, personal vendetta, future dreams. Expanded personality system beyond basic traits: Street Smart, Reformed Bad Dog, Overachiever, Zen Master, Conspiracy Theorist, The Artist. Personalities affect dialogue, animations, and reactions. Example: 'Rex, German Shepherd from Industrial Zone. Former junkyard dog. Dreams of retiring to Waterfront. Hates litterers.'

title: Jazz rhythm mini-game
description: Add 'Jazz Paws' mini-game: dog barks to the beat of jazz music. Multiple songs unlockable (bebop, blues, funk, swing). Visual rhythm indicators. Difficulty levels. Rewards: music tracks for alarm sounds, performance outfits (fedora, sunglasses). Leaderboards. Captures the jazz/urban music aesthetic from Fritz the Cat era. Adds musical engagement layer to the app.

title: UI redesign with underground comic aesthetic
description: Overhaul UI with edgier style: graffiti-inspired fonts for titles, comic panel layouts for story moments, speech bubbles instead of generic text, noir-style shadows, halftone patterns for vintage feel. Urban color palette: concrete gray, rust orange, neon accents. High contrast for readability. Move away from pastel/cute to bold/urban. Update all screens, buttons, icons. Night-time emphasis matching urban theme.

title: Urban soundscape & jazz audio system
description: Implement layered audio system: Jazz/blues/funk/lo-fi music for different contexts (menu/training/night/success). Environmental audio: city sounds (traffic, sirens, conversations, construction), neighborhood-specific ambiance, time-based variations. Enhanced dog vocalizations: grumbles, sighs, snorts, personality-based barks. Dynamic audio mixing. Music tracks unlock as rewards. Captures jazz age meets modern city vibe.

title: Achievement system overhaul with edgy names
description: Redesign achievement system with attitude and humor. Examples: 'Bark & Disorderly' (100 alarms), 'Meter Maid's Worst Nightmare' (save from 10 tickets), 'Concrete Jungle Survivor' (park in all neighborhoods), 'Street Cred' (max downtown reputation), 'Reformed' (perfect behavior streak), 'Gentrification Witness' (see neighborhood change). 50+ achievements with witty names and descriptions. Unlock street fashion items, badges, trophies.

title: Tag the Tagged street art mini-game
description: Mini-game where dog identifies and 'marks' graffiti tags in neighborhood. Timed challenge, spot-the-difference mechanics. Educational about street art styles. Different tags per neighborhood (Arts Quarter has most). Rewards: street cred points, neighborhood knowledge, unlocks tagging-related accessories (spray paint collar charm, artist beret). Adds urban culture element and makes environment interactive.

title: Implement alarm activation/deactivation logic
description: Main alarm logic with timer, activation flow, and deactivation with unlock code
acceptance_criteria:
GIVEN the user wants to activate the car alarm
WHEN they press the activation button
THEN the app should:
- Show countdown timer (30-60 seconds configurable)
- Allow cancellation during countdown
- Start monitoring after countdown
- Require unlock code/pattern to deactivate
- Show clear visual feedback of alarm state
- Prevent accidental deactivation

AUTOMATED TESTS REQUIRED:
‚úì Unit Tests:
  - Countdown timer counts down correctly
  - Timer can be cancelled
  - Alarm state transitions correctly (inactive‚Üícountdown‚Üíactive‚Üítriggered‚Üídeactivated)
  - Unlock code validation works
  - Unlock code hashing/security

‚úì Widget Tests:
  - Countdown displays correctly
  - Activation button disabled during countdown
  - Unlock screen appears when active
  - Visual state indicators show correct state

‚úì Integration Tests:
  - Full activation ‚Üí detection ‚Üí trigger ‚Üí deactivation flow
  - Incorrect unlock code blocks deactivation
  - Alarm reactivation works after deactivation
  - State persists across app restart

MANUAL TESTS:
- Activate with different countdown times
- Try canceling at various points
- Attempt deactivation without code
- Test unlock code entry UX
- Verify visual clarity of each state

DONE WHEN:
- All automated tests pass
- Code coverage ‚â•85% for alarm state machine
- Unlock code is securely stored (hashed)
- UX is intuitive (user testing)
- No accidental activations/deactivations
notes: USER MANUAL UPDATE REQUIRED: Document alarm activation in 'Getting Started > Your First Alarm Activation' and 'Core Features > Activating the Car Alarm'. Include: step-by-step guide with screenshots, countdown timer, unlock code setup, deactivation process, safety tips.

title: Activate GuardDog button provides no visual feedback when clicked
description: When clicking the green 'Activate GuardDog' button on the GuardDog Alarm screen, nothing visible happens. The user gets no feedback that their action was registered. Need to add visual feedback (loading spinner, button state change, etc.) to indicate the activation is processing.

title: Activating in X seconds doesn't show countdown timer
description: The app shows text 'Activating in X seconds' but the X doesn't actually count down. Users expect to see a real countdown timer (e.g., 5...4...3...2...1) to know when activation will complete. Implement a proper countdown timer that updates every second.

title: Cancel Activation button provides no visual feedback
description: When clicking the 'Cancel Activation' button during countdown, the cancellation appears to work but provides no visual feedback to the user. Add confirmation message, button state change, or animation to show the cancellation was successful.

title: Add real-time sensor measurement progress bar when GuardDog is active
description: When GuardDog is active, users need real-time visual feedback showing what the sensors are measuring. Add a progress bar (0-100%) that shows current sensor reading levels. When the bar reaches 100%, the dog should bark. This gives users immediate feedback when they move the phone to test the sensitivity.

title: Verify bark sounds play when sensor reaches 100%
description: Verify that dog bark sounds actually play when sensor measurements reach 100%. Test the integration between the sensor detection system and the bark sound playback. Ensure the correct breed bark plays at the right volume.

title: Download dog bark sound files for all 7 breeds from free sound sources
description: Search for and download free dog bark sound files for all 7 breeds from free sound sources (e.g., freesound.org, zapsplat.com). Need realistic, high-quality bark sounds for: German Shepherd, Rottweiler, Doberman, Chihuahua, Bulldog, Beagle, Pitbull. Ensure sounds are royalty-free and properly licensed.

title: Doggy Dogs Dog World
description: A game version of Doggy Dogs car alarm that transforms the app into an interactive location-based experience. Players can walk around with virtual gaming goblins/dogs using the mobile phone's location sensors. Inspired by Fritz the Cat aesthetics and built using Spritely Goblins for distributed object programming. Features include: location-based dog/goblin interactions, walking around to discover and interact with virtual dogs in real-world locations, and connecting the game world to mobile device location and sensors.

Implement background monitoring

GIVEN the user activates the alarm
WHEN the app is in background or screen is off
THEN it should:
- Continue monitoring sensors
- Trigger barking on detection
- Show notification when alarm triggers
- Preserve battery life (optimize polling)
- Survive app being killed by OS

AUTOMATED TESTS REQUIRED:
‚úì Unit Tests:
  - WorkManager tasks schedule correctly
  - Background service starts/stops properly
  - Sensor monitoring continues in background
  - Battery optimization logic works
  - Wake locks are acquired/released correctly

‚úì Widget Tests:
  - Background status indicator shows correctly
  - Battery usage estimate displayed

‚úì Integration Tests:
  - Alarm continues working when screen off
  - Detection triggers notification
  - Alarm survives app restart
  - Multiple background sessions don't conflict

MANUAL TESTS:
- Activate alarm, turn off screen, trigger motion after 1 min
- Activate alarm, close app, trigger motion
- Check battery drain over 1 hour period
- Test on different Android versions

DONE WHEN:

- Code coverage ‚â•75% for background service

- Alarm survives screen off for 8+ hours
- Works on Android 10, 11, 12, 13+
